title: 84 Years Later, a New Look at the Nazi Attacks of Kristallnacht
description: Newly released photographs of the assaults on Jews during the 1938 pogrom, which is widely commemorated as the start of the Holocaust, had been kept by a former American serviceman.
dc:creator: Christopher F. Schuetze
media:description: A photo released by Yad Vashem, the World Holocaust Remembrance Center, of German Nazis and civilians watching the ransacking of Jewish property during the attacks, known as Kristallnacht, taken most likely in the town of Fürth, Germany, on Nov. 10, 1938.
